definition: to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: Each time a child follows through with a task, he receives a sticker.
sentences.chinese: 每次孩子按照指示做完家务，他都会得到一个贴纸。

sentences.english: Maybe you give them a sticker or a toy.
sentences.chinese: 也许给他们一张贴纸，或者一个玩具。

sentences.english: Well, why did your dad have a gay sticker on his car?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么你爸爸把同性恋贴纸贴在他车上？

sentences.english: The other scratch was relatively minor and probably a replacement factory decal will fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 这部份刮伤比较轻微，只要更换贴纸即可。

sentences.english: The surface may gush different lacquer, but paster , strike LOGO.
sentences.chinese: 表面可喷不同的漆，可贴纸，打LOGO。

sentences.english: Yet, we have taken that phrase, and we have made bumper stickers out of it and t-shirts and everything else.
sentences.chinese: 我们把它制作成汽车保险杠贴纸，T恤衫和其他东西。

sentences.english: Look, it even had a bar-code price sticker on it! It looked brand new.
sentences.chinese: 你看，上面甚至还有价格条码贴纸，看起来是全新的。

sentences.english: The bumper sticker, if you want peace work for justice,that's where James is.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险杠贴纸，雅各的观点是让和平为公正效力。

sentences.english: Surfboards, Stickers, Sandwich Cookies, Concrete Roofing Tiles.
sentences.chinese: 冲浪板，贴纸，三明治饼干，混凝土屋面瓦。

sentences.english: But when Noel goes to answer the door, he actually starts pulling off the first one.
sentences.chinese: 但当Noel去应门时，他却开始把贴纸往下拉。

sentences.english: And the group which got this done first, each member will be given a paster as a prize.
sentences.chinese: 最先收拾好的一组，每个人可以得到一张贴纸。

sentences.english: My son puts a sticker on the flag of the country/state that the coin represents.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子给硬币所代表的那个国家的国旗上安一张贴纸。

sentences.english: The photo below is his 'drawing' by his sticky tape.
sentences.chinese: 下图是他用胶贴纸‘画’出的画。

sentences.english: I want to put a sticker on it, and call it Happy Leg.
sentences.chinese: 我要在这个假腿上粘一张贴纸，叫它“快乐的腿”。

sentences.english: Chandler: I used to have that bumper sticker.
sentences.chinese: 我以前有一个那样的保险杆贴纸。

sentences.english: Those decals, I always hate that when you buy a picture frame and the sticker's on it.
sentences.chinese: 这些贴纸，我讨厌在买到画框时上面有不干胶贴纸。

definition: to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
toy figurine/action figure/stuffed animal/doll/(fig.) sb's plaything
to stick/to affix/to adhere/to paste (as in "copy and paste")/Taiwan pr. [nian2 tie1]/also written 黏貼|黏贴[nian2 tie1]
protective or tinted film (for LCD screens, car windows etc)/facial mask (cosmetics)
